Title: Phone constantly crashes. Battery is junk. Sold me ...
Body: Phone constantly crashes. Battery is junk. Sold me a piece of junk and I want my money back. Don't buy. Spend the extra cash and go through a decent company

Title: One Star
Body: I bought 2 iPhones with this seller, both have problems and I can't return them.

Title: Need a New Battery
Body: I bought the phone in December 2016 and it is now April 2017 and Apple informed me that the battery has reached the end of its life and they are charging me $80 to replace it.

Title: Phone stopped working altogether
Body: I bought this phone in July 2016.  As of this past week, it has stopped working altogether.  I contacted the seller for assistance, and because more than 90 days had past - there was nothing they could do.  I tried working with Apple to troubleshoot to no avail.  I'm not even able to restore the phone to factory defaults using iTunes because of the error messages.  Right now, the phone won't even turn on.  At the time I purchased the phone, it was listed as a "certified refurbished" product.  After paying nearly $400, I would like to think that the phone should last at least a few years.  I just purchased a brand new iPhone directly from an AT&T store and hope for better luck.  I will never trust "certified refurbished" again.

Title: Bad phone never again
Body: The cellphone is broken and the battery is old when the technician open it up to fix it. Super bad experience

Title: Legit
Body: Awesome shipping. Awesome product. Was better than i anticipated. You made my son a happy boy. Pop the sim card in and set it up and easy as that. Highly recommended.

Title: Item not working, have to pay out of pocket to return
Body: Item came with the battery not working. And the seller didn't give any return label as well, have to pay out of pocket to ship the item back..Its a waste of money. They didn't do any certification, seem to just acquire the product and re-ship to the Amazon buyers. This seller should be banned from Amazon for not meeting the quality (I can see the same issue happening to a lot of people).

Title: Buy from Apple
Body: Like many have already written, you take a risk with refurbished. I've never had an issue before, but this is the first time an iPhone has given me issues. Right after the warranty ended, the iOS starting causing problems. The phone randomly opens apps and periodically shuts itself off..The battery is the biggest issue. It needs to be charges 3 or 4 times a day. I literally walk around with a powerbank to keep it from dying. It will lose 50-70% of the battery within 30 minutes. It does charge quickly but it dies just as fast...Cosmetically the phone was perfect. No dents or scratches, but the battery issue is extremely frustrating.

Title: Extremely pleased with this purchase
Body: Extremely pleased with this purchase, at first I thought it was too good to be true but I made the Order and it was here in a matter of days and works very well no problems yet

Title: Worn out battery
Body: Battery in this phone only has 51% capacity left meaning it won‚Äôt hold a charge long at all and it unexpectedly shuts down. On the upside Apple has a promotion going on where I could go to apple store and get a new battery for $30. I found a cellphone store that replaced it for $60 since I don‚Äôt have an apple store close by and phone works perfect.

Title: Battery problems?
Body: the phone comes in great condition! the only problem is when i went to charge it, it would charge for a short while then stop.I thought it would a problem with the battery but it ended up being the power cable. If anyone else has that problem i suggest you try another power cable! it worked for me and my phone works perfectly now :)

Title: This phone is just an iPod Touch. Why did no one test this?
Body: I like apple. I like text replacement and certain apps I am able to get. I DO NOT like receiving a phone I paid so much for that DOESNT EVEN WORK AS A PHONE. I didn‚Äôt order an iPod Touch. I ordered a phone. The caller cannot hear the recipient and the recipient cannot hear the caller. The touch screen is faulty where you have to keep touching to make something work. It will only stay connected to metro for a short time and so if I go anywhere other than home this little box is useless. To top it all off I work off my phone, and I‚Äôm losing time because of your carelessness.  I‚Äôve never had trouble with phones from Groupon. Don‚Äôt put a ‚Äúcertified refurbished ‚Äú ticket in boxes if you have not tested the product personally. I‚Äôve never been so mad. I love amazon but you can probably guess you won‚Äôt be receiving $13 a month from me anymore..The man I spoke to last night barely spoke English, didn‚Äôt are about customer service, but um hi, without us customers y‚Äôall would not be getting paid. You should consider treating us better with care and products that work.

Title: Certified Refurbisher Sells iPhone6 with Broken Wi-Fi Antenna
Body: This POS phone had a broken Wi-Fi antenna. I set it up before I left the US but didn't realize that the Wi-Fi only connected because I was in the same room as the router. I put it back in the box and into my luggage. When I got back to Vietnam and gave it to my girlfriend, she had problems connecting to Wi-Fi almost immediately. After a month of hearing about it, we took the phone to an Apple-authorized repair facility where they told us that the case had been almost imperceptibly bent and the Wi-Fi antenna broken. I cannot return it because I'm still in Vietnam--it's sitting in a drawer where it will stay until we need to scavenge it for parts. If the vendor is really certified to refurbish, they should have known the Wi-Fi antenna was broken.

Title: Great product!
Body: It was expected to arrive a week after I ordered it but to my surprise, got to me only 2 days after I ordered it. Everything came in a nice box with oem charger chord and block. The phone also looks to be in perfect condition. Great product overall and would buy again! (Update) the phone came partially charged which is helpful. Or has been 24hrs later and I do realize the phone is not holding a charge. Meaning I probably need Togo replace it with another battery for $60. A total purchase of $310 is still more affordable than some other sellers here on amazon though, so I'm not that mad. Would still recommend but fair warning on the battery~

Title: The cell phone arrived in excellent condition, no scratches
Body: The cell phone arrived in excellent condition, no scratches, completely new. So far I have not had any problems with it. I recommend it. I have AT & T so I had no problems using it. I will continue to update this

Title: Do not buy this phone
Body: It comes in a brown box with just a charger, the screen has a yellow stain all around the edges, you charge it to 100% and make a 15min phone call and the battery drops to 28% totally not worth $300.

Title: Phone doesn‚Äôt work & CSR/technicians rude
Body: The volume doesn‚Äôt work on the phone we received. I have requested a call multiple times and the technician is rude and hangs up on my son. I‚Äôm currently in Japan visiting my daughter and I bought the phone for my son anyway.

Title: FAKE PHONE!
Body: Tried to insert SIM card to use phone and it would not connect to the cell network for T-Mobile. Took the phone into 2 different T-Mobile stores and called the T-Mobile customer service line to troubleshoot. When I called the T-Mobile they said the IMEI number was incorrect for the phone, which I thought was just because she had heard it wrong. Then after visiting the second T-Mobile store to look at other phones and troubleshoot my current phone the T-Mobile associate informed me the phone was probably a fake due to the appearance of the phone. Phone stickers said Verizon network when it was received as well with a big black dot sticker trying to cover that up. BEWARE OF FAKE IPHONES BEING SOLD HERE!!!

Title: Inside of phone was corroded with paint!
Body: I bought the iPhone 6 refurbished from the vendor DealFisher on Amazon in December, 2017.  The phone worked pretty good, sometimes the sound on phone calls wasn't great.  My family member who used the phone started noticing a white residue on the edges of the screen of the phone, but never paid much mind to it.  DealFisher, the vendor, offered a 90 day warranty period.  So about 110 days after I purchased the phone, the phone started losing the wireless signal.  The phone could not make or receive phone calls.  This problem was intermittent.  It would work a few hours, then it would return to "searching" status.  I worked with Apple telephone support, they did all they could over the phone but the problem still persisted.  I brought the phone to shop for repairs, and when the technician opened the phone, we all saw that THE INSIDE OF THE PHONE WAS CORRODED WITH OFF-WHITE PAINT!!!!  I am quite certain that no one in my family who handled the phone dropped it in a can of paint! While in my possession the phone was protected in an Otter Box and the Otter Box has not one trace of paint.  This damage existed prior to my purchasing the phone.  I contacted the vendor, who told me that my warranted had expired.  That was it, no offer to speak with anyone.

Title: works but has a few issues
Body: Bought new and a week later it was having problems finding a signal.  I went on the Apple forums to find a solution, and I found a temporary one.  Now 2 weeks later I'm having the signal search issue again and using the temporary fix.  But I don't want to keep using the temporary fix because who knows what else I am doing to the phone.  I will probably return it and get a 6S.

Title: The phone was not appropriate. It took several tries ...
Body: The phone was not appropriate.  It took several tries and many hours to get it to a full change with it then loosing that finally established charge almost instantly.  I dare say that I could have just replaced the battery.  However, in checking with AT&T I was able to get a new, comparable phone for $50 more than this used one.  So..... I am returning this phone rather than spending more money and then hoping it would work properly.

Title: Unimpressed
Body: I thought  I was getting a good deal, but it seems like you get what you pay for. As soon as I transferred my data from my old phone, this one started to glitch and the finger print didn't work and it was slow to respond and it would freeze randomly. How could that happen, especially if I went from a 32GB phone to a 64GB? Unimpressed

Title: Its not unlocked!!
Body: Phone arrived in time. It looks like new, only 2 tiny scratches on the back that were no problem to me. It came dead and i connected it to the generic charger that came with it, took too long to charge and when i took it to my carrier that is metro pcs, they couldn't activated cause it was locked. Im very dissapointed since it says in the description that its gsm unlocked and it clearly isn't. Im sending it back

Title: Great buy!
Body: Best price compared to any other seller that I would trust. Not a fan of used electronics but considering it‚Äôs an older generation I needed, it had to be used. This was a great product! Battery life is never good on an iPhone to begin with so I was impressed that is maintained 85% capacity. I would suggest buying a case immediately because this phone is rounded off on the edges so it is very slippery and very fragile. Over all satisfied with the seller and thankful that it came with a charger.

Title: So ticked off!
Body: Product arrived defective and glitchy. Can't charge the phone because of some crap that appears to have been stuck in the slot to charge and I guess I didn't read the info correct because it's a Verizon version and im T-MOBILE sending back for my refund!

Title: absolutely perfect, great
Body: Phone came in a day, absolutely perfect, great price

Title: Awesome Phone
Body: This phone is in excellent condition and works perfectly.  The only issue was some minor scuffs on the sides of the phone.  I wouldn't have thought much about it, if the phone hadn't been listed as like new.  Other than that it's perfect.  This phone can definitely be found for cheaper, but I felt confident buying this with the 3 month warranty.  It being certified by Amazon also gave me some peace of mind

Title: The phone came in today. It worked for a ...
Body: The phone came in today. It worked for a couple of hours and then froze. What am I even supposed to do?

Title: Faulty 'certified' refurbished phone.
Body: I purchased the "certified" refurbished iPhone 6 from this seller on June 29th which continued to have random touch screen and battery heating issues, but only intermittently which  I ignored for a while. Now it went completely bad, touch screen wouldn't work and depletes the battery...When a phone repair shop opened it, found a clearly visible previous water damage and some rust inside.. It wasn't worth getting it repaired, just got another phone since can't return it after almost 4.5 months.

Title: Be cautious when purchasing this
Body: The touchscreen is too sensitive and sometimes the screen will have a mind of its own and start doing weird things like opening apps and typing things. If you‚Äôre not constantly on your phone then you won‚Äôt really have to worry about battery life( on average 2-3 charges per day) it takes a long time to recharge about an average of 2hrs and 30 minuets. I was unaware that this phone is used and not new because if I was then I wouldn‚Äôt have purchased this item. They did not come with the standard iPhone earbuds and apple sticker for the phone but they did contain a 2 ft charger. The sound quality is very terrible but expected from an iPhone. If you want to listen to music loudly I recommend that you purchase a speaker. This phone is ok but I was disappointed in a few ways. Just be very careful and see if you‚Äôre able to take the risk of purchasing this item

Title: Battery arrived needing replacement
Body: The phone looked beautiful when it came. It already had a screen protector on and was scratchless. I quickly found, however, that using wifi, data, or calls reduced the battery by 1% or more per minute. Thinking that was excessive, I installed a battery health application on the phone. The battery design capacity is at 50% (which means 50% of its capacity relative to when it was new) and the wear level is at 49% ("Very High"). According to Apple technical specifications, batteries should be replaced when they're under 80% capacity, which means that for all intents and purposes, it's a dud battery. The screen also displays early symptoms of the dreaded iphone 6 "touch disease": the screen often becomes unresponsive to direction. It's hard to complete more than a single text sentence without the screen becoming unresponsive. Overall, the iphone 6 was buggy to begin with, but the factory refurbishing process should have caught the battery problem at the least, and the touch screen problem if done scrupulously.

Title: Do. Not. Buy.
Body: Although the phone was in perfect physical shape, it was a Japanese model (which I was not informed of nor was it posted anywhere) so the "shutter" sound when taking a picture was unable to be muted, turned off, or lowered!!! Unbelievable!!!! Even on photo taking apps such as Snapchat the sound still was present AND LOUD!! Had to drive all the way to the nearest Apple Store an hour away just to find out they couldn't do anything about it!! I wasted my own time and money driving around and making sacrifices for this phone to not work as advertised. Do not buy. Buy somewhere else and make sure it is a US model. Having the shutter sound go off may not be a deal breaker but trying to take pictures or videos in silence or public just isn't for me and is disrupting. Furious. Will be buying somewhere else as I have gone back to my old phone which luckily, I still had. Time and money wasted as well as patience and trust

Title: Great Iphone, Not original accessories and careful with the Iphone screen
Body: I got it on estimated time, the phone came with not original charger battery and headphones. I am not sure but I believe the Iphone didn't come with its original screen despite I like too much my new Iphone 6.

Title: One Star
Body: Not working

Title: One Star
Body: Phone was junk. Stuff didn't work

Title: Great phone just no earphones
Body: The phone came in a very secure box and a charger but it's not apple, had no problem setting it up to metro pcs. The reason why I have it 4 stars instead of 5 is because it did not have headphones and not an apple charger

Title: Pay attention to the seller
Body: First off, be careful what seller you purchase from.  I first ordered from Kanga and they were terrible on every level.  The volume didn't work properly, the battery was trash, and they delivered later than was promised.  I returned that phone and ordered another from DealFisher.  The phone is fine but the battery is equally as trashy as the previous phone.  I'm so disappointed but I've given up finding a decent battery.  I'll just pay another $80 and get a new one.

Title: Came early by my surprise and works perfect!
Body: The phone came in 8 hours early and caught me by surprise. I bought the Rose Gold one with 64 gigabytes of space. Don't listen to the negative reviews the phone was new and unlocked just how I wanted it. It came in a small box protected with plastic and came with a charger, but I was kinda sad I didn't get the apple earbuds tho lmao. The battery is somewhat ok but goes out fast so I plan to buy a new one but besides that the phone is fine. I have Cricket as my provider and I put in the sim card and it works with no problems. I've had the phone for almost 2 months now and just waited just in case I had any problems but everything was fine. I would recommend buying it if you want the aux cord which was the only reason why I bought it in the first place (I'll add pictures later just lazy rn lol)...Apple iPhone 6, GSM Unlocked, 64GB - Gold (Certified Refurbished)

Title: Trash
Body: Was suspicious if this was even a real iPhone at first (it is). The warranty was way too short because after about 4 months of having the phone (warranty is 3 months I believe) the service quality dropped terribly (checked with my carrier, it wasn't a problem with them) and WiFi overall just stopped working (also checked, wasn't their fault either). Nothing I can do not even send it back. The only thing they had to offer was a discount for a new phone. Just gonna be selling this and buying a new iPhone from Best Buy, where they won't rip you off.

Title: Works like new!!
Body: I just got this phone and it is amazing it works just like a new one. It came earlier than expected.One con about this product is that the logo looks fake because it looks like a mirror. Also, this phone has absolute NO scratches  While I was shopping for this product I was searching and looked at reviews and I hope this helped you with your decision with buying this product.

Title: Not really unlocked--WARNING!
Body: BEWARE. They claim it is unlocked but it may not be! The phone I purchased was supposedly a factory refurbished unlocked iPhone 6 but in reality it was locked and would not accept a new SIM card. Huge waste of time and money. Dishonest advertising.

Title: DO NOT BUY. NOT WORTH IT.
Body: If there were a negative star system, this phone would make the cut..The shipping took longer than the scheduled delivery..When it did arrive, it was completely dead. After charging it and taking it to Verizon for activation, the SIM wasn't reading. After several attempts, they had to reset the phone. Once activated, the screen would lag and opening apps was very slow. After only half a day, the screen went black and required another reset to get it working again..This is a certified refurbished piece of junk. After reading the reviews (with similar issues), I'm genuinely surprised that Amazon still consists business with this seller.

Title: PHONE HAD ISSUES SINCE THE FIRST DAY
Body: First of all the phone was a gift, upon activating the phone I noticed there was a delay with the screen sensor which I figured would get better but only got worse as time progressed. Now in order to get the sensor pad to work I have to use the side screen button to turn off screen and go back to try again. When I receive a call most of the time I cannot answer it because the sensor will not work so I have to hit the side button to cancel the call and call back after waiting for the screen to work. The phone never had water damage nor have I dropped it since receiving it. I did all the normal troubleshooting of hard-resetting and setting back to factory settings but the main issue is that it had this malfunction since day one! This company will not answer your calls or return emails either.

Title: More than I expected, great value
Body: This item arrived fast, in excellent condition, worked right out of the box, and came with a Lightning-USB cable, a generic USB wall wart, and an acceptable plastic case and screen protector.

Title: The phone itself was nice, but slightly bent
Body: The phone itself was nice, but slightly bent. My carrier is Straight Talk and I purchased a SIM card for this phone. Service worked for about an hour total and then the phone would read "searching" or "no service" in the upper left corner. I purchased three new SIM cards. I spent hours trying to resolve this issue with Straight Talk customer service and they were as helpful as could be but at the end of the day, it was a problem with the phone not reading the SIM card. The SIM card jack looked slightly bent, this may have been the contributing factor. Either way, I would warn to not buy this if you use straight talk. I went to Walmart and bought an iphone that was already set up through straight talk and it has been working fine.

Title: iPhone 6 arrived sooner than expected with a very good shape (no scratches on it)
Body: iPhone 6 arrived sooner than expected with a very good shape (no scratches on it). It turned on perfectly and unlocked well after putting my own SIM card. Looks like as it is a new phone! Worth it to purchase if you don't mind to have a non-new iPhone version.

Title: Not recommending Techarvard as a reseller.
Body: The battery was the first to go out less than a month with the product. Two months after the product the screen started flickering for no apparent reason, and now the power button isn't working. When reaching out to Techarvard the reseller and asking for advice or a refund the response was simply, No. This was the total sum of the advice. It was a risk buying from an unknown reseller, but took the chance and would not make the mistake again even though we were told it was certified and like new, it really isn't.

Title: Horrible touchscreen
Body: After about a month the touchscreen started to act up. After two, I started having to hard-reset several times a day, due to touchscreen not responding, or the phone going nuts and opening apps, closing them, calling people, etc, like someone was tapping all over the phone super fast. I‚Äôm 4 months in, and am finally at the point, even as much as I hate shopping and spending money, I am done with this phone. I will NEVER buy refurbished again.

Title: Five Stars
Body: In perfect conditionüëå

Title: this iPhone dosent work. the battery dosent work, ...
Body: this iPhone dosent work. the battery dosent work, and when your turn on the phone in about two minutes turn off. I feel cheated, and I expect that some one responde for this inconveniente. I dona want to think, that this is a fraude. Now I am out of the country and is very dificulta returned

Title: Japan phones! Do not buy unless you want to be locked out.
Body: Do not buy these phones, they are locked on Japan networks although it's advertised otherwise. When my phone updated, the Tmobile sim card was no longer recognized. I went to the apple store to try to fix but sadly they couldn't do anything. They also let me know multiple customers have come in about the same issues and all were Amazon purchases. You might luck out with an American phone but if you buy these, make sure the FIRST thing you do is check. Easiest way, put it on silent and see if the camera still makes a sound when taking a photo. It's a law in Japan the camera sound can't be turned off.

Title: Stressful
Body: This is probably the worst refurbished phone I‚Äôve ever bought. I was so disappointed. First, the phone that came wasn‚Äôt space gray, it was gold. After about a month, the phone started dying on 50 %, a week later, dies on 90%, now the phone can be on 100% and dies within minutes of it‚Äôs not plugged up. I went to a repair shop and they told me that the phone had previous water damage and the battery works fine but because of the water damage the phone had before it was refurbished, circuits are causing the battery to run dead. So now I have a bulky battery case on the phone until I Can buy a new one. Also my Touch ID won‚Äôt work, and my flashlight doesn‚Äôt work. I‚Äôll never buy a used phone again.

Title: Works like a brand new phone
Body: Normally, I would never have gotten a phone online because I‚Äôm nervous of 2nd hand electronics. To my surprise the phone works like I got it new from the store! If you want to get your kid or special someone a phone without having to pay the store price I recommend this! Make sure you buy through amazon‚Äôs certified refurbished program.

Title: Met all expectations.
Body: I bought this for my granddaughter and so far seems to be working well. It arrived a day late but but was shipped on time (postal or maybe an amazon error) The phone was as advertised. No scratches or obvious defects. The color and memory capacity are correct. The phone is unlocked as advertised. Overall I'm happy with this purchase and the seller.

Title: Worst product from amazon!
Body: This is the worst experience I have had with amazon so far. When I received the product it looked great! I turned it on and I went through the setup and it was great!... for a week. After a week the phone just shut off and we even took it to the Apple store and even they can‚Äôt fix it. Please don‚Äôt buy this!

Title: Very Disappointed
Body: I purchased this phone for my son's birthday. I put it a away for a while. First of all, the phone wasn't unlocked as promised. I got that all straightened out which took a few phone calls and emails on my part just to get it unlocked... which shouldn't have been on me since it was listed as unlocked! Then, once we tried to use it,  after like a month it would only work if plugged in and now it won't turn on at all after only 4 months. Took it to the Apple store and they tried two batteries, nothing would work. I tried to get a refund from this seller but they didn't ask for more details just declined due to being past the return date. Very disappointed and out $260...

Title: Five Stars
Body: Works wonderfully & shipped fast!

Title: $Buy$ this mf.
Body: Never buy a new phone again. The iPhone came on time and looks brand new on the front and back with little scratches on the left near the volume buttons, but idgaf I still recommend. The camera is crystal clear too. Fmoig @famouscap..I bought the space grey iPhone if wanted to know.

Title: Proceed with caution
Body: Phone arrived DOA.

Title: Exceeded my expectations even though some reviews were shady
Body: I know some of these reviews made me nervous to purchase this phone and some seemed a bit shady, but overall I was very happy with the phone I got. Notice that when you change color, however, the 3rd party organization also changes. I got my phone from MyWit and it arrived quickly and looked new. I‚Äôve had it for almost a month and it‚Äôs working perfectly, there was no visible damage or scratches. Would recommend but it‚Äôs always a risk buying a second hand phone.

Title: Five Stars
Body: Item was as expected

Title: Defective as soon as I tried to activate!
Body: From the moment I tried to activate the phone it was defective. The #‚Äôs 5 & 8 wouldn‚Äôt work and there was a black spot on the screen. Sent it back the next day.

Title: battery does not last even half a day!!!
Body: This IPhone is not working!! The battery runs off too quicky: I got it as a present for my step parents and they tell me that the battery doesn,t even last half a day. Please contact me to see what can we do about it. Thank you

Title: Issues after update attempt
Body: This phone was great until it was unable to accept updates. I tried all methods given. Then once it wouldn't update, less than 6 months after getting it, it started acting weird. The screen will come on and go off, like a slow flash continuously at random times. There's ghost touch on the screen or totally unrepsonsive. It also refused to connect to Wi-Fi sometimes. And the worst is having battery life and the phone,at random, powers off on its own. There's no warranty on it even though it's certified refurbished. This was a good phone for a short while. But not worth the money.

Title: Doesn't Work
Body: The phone didn't work. Wouldn't even start up or charge. I tried 3 different chargers including the one that was sent to me. Still did not work so I took it to an Apple store because I didn't want to give up on the phone that easily and they confirmed that the phone does not work. They couldn't even turn the device on. Such an inconvenience because I really needed the phone hence why I did 2 day shipping.

Title: The phone has high power consumption
Body: The phone works well, but the power consumption drives me mad. I turn off the app background refresh and location service, and don't use the phone, it consumes 1% power every 10 minutes. After searching relevant information on the internet, I find it may be the problem on the motherboard. I will ask the seller to change another phone for me, hope it will work.

Title: Phone looks like New and is working great
Body: Positive experience! Phone looks like New and is working great. My son loves it. I feel good about the 90 day certified product guarantee! Win all the way around. I will review again after 90 days. üòÄ

Title: iPhone 6
Body: Had to return the phone, the main problem was that the button turning on wifi would not respond.

Title: Great price on a great refurbished phone...
Body: Purchased two iPhone 6 phones, and read the reviews about how awful this company is. What a load of hogwash. Both phones were fully functional, clean, refurbished, and running fine. Bought one from them before. A small glitch had me send the phone back and they sent an almost new one. Most of the complaints are for the non-Apple chargers and cord, or the plain box it comes in, or their own inability to use the phone. I'll bet if you, informed Apple user, know how to use an iPhone without tech support having to do things for you, and you understand a return for service warranty and it doesn't include repairs for your part in damaging a phone, then you'll love this place for a great refurbished phone for less than what others will have to pay. My kids are thrilled, and won't put them down...

Title: Phone was like new
Body: The phones was just like new, however I sent back, my mistake I thought I was ordering the 6 Plus, return was no problem.

Title: Do not waste your money
Body: The phone arrived with a defective SIM card reader.  I didn‚Äôt know this at the time of purchase because it appeared, initially, to be a problem with my phone service provider. I would reset the phone and it would work for a few weeks, then I  would need to get another SIM card and again it would work for several weeks before crapping our again. After months of having to reset the phone and get the SIM card replaced over and over and spending far too many hours at the Verizon store and on the phone with their customer service reps, it was determined to be a problem that the phone had from the beginning.  When I contacted Aye about getting a repair or replacement, I was told there was nothing to be done because it was out of warranty. Do not waste your money. You may think you‚Äôre getting a deal, until you realize that they will not stand by their products. You‚Äôre better off going to the Apple store and paying full price. At least they will replace their products when they are determined to be defective through no fault of the buyer.

Title: TERRIBLE BATTERY!!! Don't purchase unless you want to gamble whethe or not your phone will hold a charge for more than 2 hours.
Body: the phone came with a fried up battery, absolutely atrocious. It barely held a charge for about an hour and 30 mins. In the end, the only 'solution' was to return the phone and re-order it with hopes to get a decent battery. Of course,e this's a game that no-one should play; therefore, I quickly walked away with my money back and a sour taste of disappointment.

Title: and does not contain crap The second device contains a few scratches but also ...
Body: I bought 2 iPhones from you, the color is red .. the two are in re-manufacturing mode..The first device was a new device and does not contain the effects of the use .. and does not contain crap..The second device contains a few scratches but also beautiful..The devices were working excellently..I am happy to deal with you and I am happy to buy from you again

Title: DO NOT BUY FROM THIS COMPANY.
Body: DO NOT ORDER!! They say that the phones are referbished but my came with a dead battery. I have to keep it connected to the charger all the time and if I unplug it it dies instantly. It starts to start up and goes to the charging icon 6-7 times before it turns on. I am very disappointed with this product. I wouldn't want anyone to go through what I am. I would give this company negative stars if I could. They say one thing but send you a product that contradicts them. I would send it back but I can't because this is my only way of communicating.

Title: The phone wouldn‚Äôt work. We took it into AT&T ...
Body: The phone wouldn‚Äôt work.  We took it into AT&T and Apple.  They said the phone would not work.  I have to say the company did send a pre-paid label to return it.  I haven‚Äôt received the credit yet so we will see how the rest goes!

Title: Didnt last 4 months.
Body: Bought in June, by October,  screen was loose  and had vertices striped lines. Touch did not work anymore. Had to spend an additional $100 to get it repaired

Title: FAULTY IPHONE
Body: If I could give a zero star, I would. I bought a certified refurbished iPhone 6 4 months ago but it just stop working. At first I thought the battery had died but when I took it to a specialist, they said the motherboard was fried. There wasn‚Äôt any water damage or other damage that would be the cause of it. The specialist said they should have never sold the phone as it was on its last legs. When I called the company to ask for a refund or replacement, they said since it was past the 3 month warranty day they couldn‚Äôt help me. THEY SOLD ME A BASICALLY BROKEN PHONE. Do not waste your money! The only upside was that the outside of the phone looked almost brand new.

Title: We received the phone in great condition and is working fine so far
Body: We received the phone in great condition and is working fine so far. It was 3 day later then we expected but that is the way UPS and Fed Ex is with different weather forecasts. So far very pleased.

Title: reclamo
Body: Hola!.Estoy usando el telefono hace tres dias y empezo a funcionar mal la bateria. Me gustaria que me ayuden a poder solucionarlo ya que esperaba que el celular funcione correctamente. Les comento cual es el problema..El celular parece tener bateria al 80 % y a los dos minutos tiene 10% y luego se apaga. Luego lo cargo y rapidamente recupera la bateria y mas tarde se apaga abruptamente..Pueden ayudarme a resolver este asunto? De no ser asi, puedo recurperar mi dinero y devolver el equipo?..gracias.saludos

Title: Doesn't work with Sprint
Body: Doesn't work with Sprint.  Tech ok, but the one I received wasn't acceptable to their network.  Amazon handled the return flawlessly.

Title: Don‚Äôt buy!
Body: So at first the phone was great but as time went on I noticed the battery life was so bad!!!! I can charge my phone all night and I‚Äôm like an hour only have like 30 percent and then I turn it off and back on I all of the sudden have 60 percent! Then at like 20 percent sometimes it will just die and not turn back on but as soon as I put it on the charger is has 40 percent when it turn back on! I would buy the battery life is bad!!

Title: Software problem
Body: I purchase the iPhone 6 certified refurbished after the third month the operating system crashed and no way to restore or update don't waste your money

Title: so good. Outside is perfect
Body: So far, so good. Outside is perfect, running like new. Will update if anything change...***so a few months in now. This phone randomly shuts off. One day I go to unlock it and it just stayed black. I thought I lost it for good, but I looked up how to restart it, which is what I ended up having to do. This has happened at least three times now and more often. Don't buy. I'm sure I'll need to purchase a new phone soon. -_-

Title: Flawless
Body: Why bad reviews? It‚Äôs been 8 months and my phone works flawless, no battery problem, great resolution, and amazing. I have traveled UK, Canada, South Asia with his phone and changed various international GSM sim. And now buying again for a family memeber. Go for it.

Title: one good/one horrible
Body: I purchased two of these phones for Christmas presents.  One worked well and continues to work well.  One slowly started to lose functionality whereby the screen increasingly lost sensitivity to touch.  Five months after purchase the phone is unusable.  Return these phones immediately if there are any indications of issues.

Title: but in the end I'm very happy with my purchase
Body: Reading these other reviews I was a bit hesitant to buy, but in the end I'm very happy with my purchase. It works with my carrier and is in perfect condition. Its an actual Iphone and I have a 90 day warranty so if anything goes wrong with the phone I am covered. It runs smoothly and I haven't had any issued with the product in any way shape or form. It's a great purchase and you get what you pay for.

Title: Good phone, battery is so-so
Body: DISCLAIMER: I bought the phone as a gift for someone else so my experience is merely hearsay and the one day I spent with it. That being said, I was very satisfied with the phone. The screen doesn't seem to have any scratches on it but the metal case is a little scuffed up, which is to be expected from a refurbished phone. After a couple days of use, the user told me that the phone had turned off once at 10% and then booted back up after being plugged in saying it was at 47%. So far that's the only issue they've had with the phone. Good phone and some cute a$$ wannabe-iPhone packaging, 9/10.

Title: Five Stars
Body: Love it. No scratches or anything

Title: Five Stars
Body: Great purchase. Phone is really good and delivered as promised..Purchased in March 2017 and still working great!.I wish it had Manufacturer box, headphones but i was completely aware that it is unavailable before i made purchase...Thank you!

Title: Not unlocked
Body: I bought the phone for a friend out of the country as a gift. Phone was supposed to come unlocked but wasn't and when taken to store to get network "unlocked", they said they couldn't because it was already unlocked.

Title: It works fine.
Body: The clear film protecting the screen was loose at the corner, but that's okay considering it's refurbished.  Everything else was good as new.  It works perfectly.

Title: Piece of Junk
Body: When I received the phone the device could not figure out how much battery it had. I have no idea what the issue was, but the phone would constantly change the amount of battery remaining in the top corner of the screen so I had no idea what the battery level was. Fortunately I could return it back to Amazon for a full refund, but it was still a huge pain in the ass.

Title: It's horrible we have bought the new iPhone
Body: It's horrible  we have bought the new iPhone, but we received the phone in opened box without original box, without any documents and no pasport, we didn't get the headphones also. We are not sure that this is an iPhone,  but we are pretty sure that it is not new.

Title: Did Not Turn On!!
Body: I received the phone and it looks great but it would not charge and wouldn't turn on. Waste of money. I would suggest not to buy from this buyer

Title: Cute ladies (rose gold) phone. Give you that ‚Äúboss‚Äù status!
Body: When I received phone I was a little skeptical about based on the negative reviews listed. Me personally O came  package neatly in a white box with the charge. Also I tested and saw everything was wiped off so it‚Äôs clean ready for any sim chip. I too love how the phone is a rose gold color. My only downside is if you love music on your phone as ringtone you will have to purchase it. Overall phone is nice I plan to take care of mine really well hope to upgrade to iPhone 7/8

Title: I like the product
Body: I like the product, fast shipping ! The phone looks like new, but doesn't work like new, the touchscreen get blocked sometimes!

Title: Five Stars
Body: Looked brand new and works great. Shipping was also very quick. Thank you!

Title: You‚Äôre getting a Used phone, not a refurbished one.
Body: Got the phone and had trouble with the ear piece. I brought it into a tech at Apple and this is what he said ‚ÄúI‚Äôve worked here almost 10 years and I‚Äôve never seen this much debris build up in an ear piece.‚Äù So no, it was not refurbished. They‚Äôre just used phones sold as ‚Äúrefurbished‚Äù.

Title: Meh
Body: It's refurbished, so it's going to have its kinks. But there is something loose in the screen so it glitches out and you have to apply pressure to make it clear again. At one points it had deleted all of my contacts and glitches out in other ways. But the phone has visible damage though

Title: Who certified it? Ray Charles?
Body: Got the phone in April. End of August it shut down and wouldn't do anything to come back on. Told me my 90 day warranty had passed which it had but upon taking the phone apart found that the phone had been underwater at some point and it appears to have had a piece or 2 replaced in order to resell it. Take 50% of your money and light it on fire and go buy something that isn't garbage. You'll save yourself 50%.

Title: Whether you a Mom, Student or working person don't waste your hard earned money on this horrid product!
Body: For the first week, this worked great after that the touch screen is not working. I go to call, the person does not answer I can't end the call. I try to use an app its clicking on the top area when my finger is touching the middle or bottom area. Complete horrid product!..The person that passed this as QC really needs to loose their job. I am a single mom and putting out $300.00 is quite an expense, shame on the company or person that sold this phone as a working item...The only good thing about all of this is that I bought it from Amazon so I will get a refund. I have NEVER bought anything from Amazon that did not work. Amazon either don't sell refub products or place stronger restrictions on the vendors that sell.

Title: The only Iphone I ever purchased, and its defective
Body: Do NOT purchase these from Amazon site..I bought one, and flew home to my wife.In January. It's 1st usage. Barely 2 months.Old, and the phone just simply dies after it.Has been turned on for an hour or more. Once it cools off, it usually works again, TEMPORARILY

Title: Just perfect!
Body: This item came perfect! I love the phone and it came with everything it said it would. It is easy to use, it has absolutely no problems.

Title: Although a refurbished and very new looking. During the ...
Body: Although a refurbished and very new looking. During the process of refurbishing an internal part that controls GPS must have been damaged. Thiss affected the Map software on the device. Even Apple was unable to fix.

Title: Doesn‚Äôt take charge
Body: Hey, I received the iPhone, but it‚Äôs not taking charge..As I see in 2 hours it‚Äôs only 1% charge..It‚Äôs really bad , I want to return it back now..Send my money back ASAP.

Title: I enjoyed the phone however it was just slightly smaller then ...
Body: I enjoyed the phone however it was just slightly smaller then I had initially anticipated. But this isn't the fault of the merchant I just simply didn't do my research. I received this item in within the specified time and enjoyed it for what little time I had however, I've since then upgraded to the iPhone 6 plus which is a lot larger in my opinion.. The downside to this item is that their seem to have been an issue with the volume, I could barley hear the callers during phone conversations.

Title: Keeps shutting off.
Body: My son in college needed a replacement phone and this was worse than his old one. He said there's a click sound sometimes when he taps on the screen and it keeps shutting off on him with over 50% battery left.

Title: The phone won't stay on for more than a few minutes.
Body: It took four hours of charging after I received the phone for it to even turn on, and after i FINALLY got it to turn on after almost giving up, the thing dies on 90% battery. So, I put it back on the charger for 10 minutes and pulled it off again only for it to die a few minutes later. Long story short, don't waste your time or money on this "certified refurbished" sh*t because obviously it isn't. (side note: if you were going to refurbish any part of a phone why would you skip the battery??? that's like the most important part????)

Title: ... this phone for 3 months now and it‚Äôs been great to me
Body: I‚Äôve had this phone for 3 months now and it‚Äôs been great to me. I feel like it was a reasonable price and it is my first iPhone ever since I‚Äôve always had Samsung but I didn‚Äôt want to spend full price on a phone for TMobile

Title: Obviously Not Fully Tested
Body: Phone had a stain on the back from a previous case and the battery was shot, would not hold a charge.

Title: the phone works perfectly no problems it‚Äôs like new I appreciate them sending me the charger since ...
Body: CANT complaint for the purchase I did my 5 years old son loves it ..the phone works perfectly no problems it‚Äôs like new I appreciate them sending me the charger since it didn‚Äôt come with the phone but that says everything about a good seller customer satisfaction I will return to buy more phones in the future my brothers and sisters are looking to buy phones from ur company any day for there own kids thanks

Title: Having battery issues ? Does it turn off after fully charged ?
Body: I was really excited and happy because my last phone I had given away and I decided to buy myself a new one sadly .. when I got it I charged it and waited so I could login and we‚Äôll that . After I unplugged it turned off . It showed the battery and how you needed to charge so I thought maybe it because it hasn‚Äôt been used in so long but then it kept doing that after charging it and I got tired of it so now I‚Äôm returning... I hope they check the phones before they sell them .

Title: Screen does not work
Body: We just received this refurbished item yesterday. While I know a refurbished phone is not brand new, it should work, and the screen does not work.  It freezes, and the touch aspect of the screen does not work.

Title: Died in less than 6 months.
Body: I bought this as a refurb not six months ago and it has already died. Battery won't hold charge.

Title: First for my daughter was great, this one for me
Body: The mic doesn't work when on calls. Have to use speaker phone for the other person to hear you. 2nd refurb iphone 6 purchase from this seller. First for my daughter was great, this one for me, not in complete working order.

Title: with a good battery life
Body: On GOD this phone looks brand new ,unused, unissued before me. It‚Äôs fast, charges fast, with a good battery life. Only thing is it gets hot after extended use of about say an hour or so. This is my first iPhone so I don‚Äôt quite know if the hot battery is normal or not but I‚Äôll try to give an updated review after a few weeks.... If possible.

Title: Worst cell phone
Body: Worst cell phone ever, it did not charge and when I used original apple charger it charged super slow. Then, at one point after all night of full charge, battery charge dropped to 10% drastically and the phone died in matter of second. I am never gonna buy iphones online outside of the apple original site because the cell phone was suppose to be the only means of communication with my gf when she was out of the country and I was relying on this cell phone to work. Terrible waste of money.

Title: Overal i think is i pretty good product the packaging is not the best but ...
Body: I have had it for about 3-4 weeks so far and it works well the volume has gone out on me once before but ever since it occurred i haven't had any problems. Overal i think is i pretty good product the packaging is not the best but the phone came without a scratch it looked brand new. I will try to update my feedback after a month or 2

Title: Thank God I got a great phone it's perfect was fast shipping and super easy ...
Body: Thank God I got a great phone it's perfect was fast shipping and super easy to hook up at Metro I luv this phone scared about reviews but I ordered before reading them other wise I probably wouldn't

Title: Had an Apple store check out the phone and the best response I got was its not able to be ...
Body: This phone lasted 35 days. It died because that happens sometimes. Had an Apple store check out the phone and the best response I got was its not able to be repaired. So I paid $10 a day for a phone so a full star rating is too much!

Title: Terrible battery
Body: The battery on my phone is horrible. I charge it the majority of the day and all night long. I just used it for about ten minutes and it went from full charge to 'dead battery' and shut off. Then I can't turn it on until I plug it in and then it goes back up to the full charge until I use it for ten minimum more. So frustrating! I tried to contact the seller but didn't get a response. I guess it's time to go to an Apple Store.

Title: Battery terrible, do not buy!
Body: The battery in this phone is completely defective. Within less than 30 minutes of moderate use, the phone was down to 65% and then suddenly died. I checked the battery capacity and it is only 71% of what it would have been as a new phone. After recharging the phone, it continued to die suddenly - some times at 50% and other times at 80%. A refurbished phone should absolutely have a good battery installed, and I feel that the seller neglected to do this.

Title: Definitely met my expectations!
Body: I purchased a 64GB refurbished iphone 6 gold from MyWit. I must say the service provided by the seller was almost excellent!.1) Shipping - 5/5.It was very fast! I ordered it on Tuesday and it was supposed to arrive on Friday but came in a day earlier. So awesome job..2) Package - 4.5/5.As shown in the attached photo, the phone came in the seller's custom box with an OEM charger + USB cable. I don't think it's the same as Apple's because the material felt a bit more plastic like. However, the box came very dusty. I almost thought the iphone screen came cracked but turned out to be some dust..3) Phone - 4/5.I purposely picked this one because the description says the phone should "look like new, with minimal to no signs of wear." Not sure what the definition of minimal signs of wear but there are few scratches that indicate "not new." The first thing I noticed was this deep scratch on the back of the phone where I could see the grey part underneath the white paint. Then, there was these minor scratches/dent on the left-bottom of the phone as shown in the photo! Also the mic/earphone plugging holes have minor scratches around & inside. So there's the one star I took away from..4) Performance - 4.5/5.So far everything seems to work! I received it today so I might have to wait but so far, SIM Card works; fingerprint reader works; camera works; screen has no problem; no black-out issues were observed; no obvious battery issues; and it came fully unlocked (no previous user AppleID issue). The side buttons + power button work flawlessly. The phone itself seems relatively responsive just a bit laggy. It came 67% charged and so far so good! If anything comes up, I'll try to update!

Title: Excellent Buy
Body: Phone exactly as promised - good as new.

Title: Love it
Body: Love it!!! Simple great!

Title: Japan or Korean built phones.......
Body: If buying one of these refurbished phone make sure you ask the question if the phone is from Japan or Korea. These phones will always make the shutter noise while taking a picture. Truly annoying and than reason for only one star because of the lack of information.

Title: Good but not wow!
Body: The product is very clean but the touch screen freezes sometimes and the included charger doesn‚Äôt work, that‚Äôs why I didn‚Äôt give it 5 stars rating.

Title: I am very pleased with this phone
Body: I am very pleased with this phone! It came packaged professionally in a plastic phone box that was labeled "Amazon Certified Refurbished". The phone itself looked mostly new - the only flaw was a slight discoloration around the apple logo (like where somebody had a case on it), which is covered by my case anyway. The battery holds a charge all day and I had no problems getting the phone activated at AT &T. In fact, I am planning to order my husband the same phone now.

Title: Has multiple flaws that aren't evident right away (screen won't ...
Body: Has multiple flaws that aren't evident right away (screen won't turn back on if on a phone call longer than about 10 minutes for example. I rarely make calls so did not realize this till a couple months after purchase. Also, freezes up a lot. will randomly start opening apps, has a couple spots on the screen that are nearly dead to the touch. I have never gotten a phone "refurbished" phone that worked worth a damn

Title: Item as described. Certified Refurbished Unit is good buy
Body: Item as described. Battery is good. Body of phone is in good condition..recommend this seller. Fast shipping. Certified Refurbished unit is a reputable and safe buy and worth every penny

Title: iPhones are a good choice.
Body: Great Product.

Title: Four Stars

Title: Warning on refurbished phone!
Body: The phone looks great but it's awful! Do not buy these refurbished phones. It's like an iPod it will only work with wi-fi, even though I have unlimited data with at&t it will not allow you to use data. I have spent so much time on this it's ridiculous! It turns out the phone isn't unlocked either! Do not buy from Dealfisher.

Title: I am really happy with my iPhone
Body: I am really happy with my iPhone, I got a new phone! It‚Äôs was a great deal, and I hope to continue making deal with dealfisher.com. I highly recommend it. Thank you dealfisher.com‚Äôs team!!!!

Title: Works good

Title: Five Stars

Title: Apple store says this phone has fake parts inside and will not repair it
Body: Phone failed after 1 year and 2 weeks. Heated up like crazy and then black screen - Just past the 1 year warranty, of course...Apple won't repair it because it contains aftermarket fake parts. So much for "certified" refurbished. Certified by whom?..Avoid if you can.

Title: It is a great phone for texting and email
Body: It is a great phone for texting and email, but the caller volume is so low that I cannot receive or make calls.

Title: Excellent
Body: Bought it a couple months ago and still works good, great condition, excellent product

Title: Great Working Phone
Body: This was a gift for our kid. The only it needs is a sim and it is ready to go. It works great and had no issues getting it going. And of course the kid loves it.

Title: IPhone junk - Do not buy!
Body: We bought this iphone in June this year and it has a defective antenna and cannot use data outside Wi-Fi areas.  It was sporadic at first so we took it to our network provider.  The SIM card is fine it's just the phone.  I bought it for my son and he cannot make phone calls or text without Wi-Fi.  It is worthless.  Do not buy a refurbished phone.

Title: It works great. Love it
Body: Phone arrived before anticipated. It works great. Love it!

Title: Awesome!
Body: I love this phone! I cant even tell that its a used phone. ive had it for a couple months now and everything has been fine. One thing about getting used phones is the battery life isnt as great. ive noticed that my battery wouldnt last as long as most phones do but it still lasts most of my day. plus thats an easy fix you can just get a new battery! Anyways I definitley would recommend getting this

Title: De box packing is very bad

Title: Be careful
Body: I brought this back in February, the 90 day warranty is now expired and all of a sudden the phone shuts off on its own, when fully charged and takes a few minutes to come back on. Sometimes it will vibrate nonstop after it is powered off. The phone itself has always been in a case and has no damage. It's frustrating that now it decided to magically not work once I find out the warranty is no longer valid!!!

Title: Battery is dead after 5 months.....
Body: Bought this iphone last April. Afyer 5 montjs of regular use, battery is absolutely dead, lasting 20 minutes when fully charged and without even usibg it as a phone. This is really a shame, refurbished certified should mean its a good product, now I feel my money was taken from me!! I do expect a solution and the money fully refund, that would at least calm what I think right now!!!!!

In two(2) weeks after the battery started swelling ,this cause the sides to open and the phone keeps shutting down.

Body: The phone is fine, but the SIM card plate is defective. Every once in a while the SIM keeps coming out of place and  when it does that my phone begins to search for network and it takes up to 24 hours to find a network back  which is very inconvenient .. Is there anyway that I can get my I SIM card plate repair ??

Title: Unfortunately not a good experience
Body: Not good!  The screen was bad, going dark and leaving outlines of previous screen images and the phone would go nuts opening things and pressing buttons automatically by istself.  We tried contacting Vius customer service several times by phone without success - kept getting an answering machine.  No response to an email either.  We finally returned it via Amazon since we have Amazon Prime.

Title: Can‚Äôt disable camera click noise
Body: No where in my order did this show as a phone that came from Japan. This phone was for my 13 year old who is passionate about photography. So I hear this camera click quite often, with no way to mute it.

Title: No return
Body: The phone, unfortunately, has "touch screen disease" and I can't return it because the 7 day window doesn't do much good when it had to travel overseas as a gift before it is opened. $350 is a lot of money with virtually no realistic warranty. That's the gamble, I guess.

Title: Bad experience!
Body: I bought the phone in July 2017 and it was working perfectly. Around three months after the purchase, a problem called "ghost touch" appeared. The phone cannot be used at all as random ghost touches that open Apps and dial people start immediately after I unlock the phone. I took the phone to a repair shop and I was informed that there is a high chance that power module will be affected if they try to fix it. I really regret buying this phone.

Title: Beware! LOCKED phone

Title: The battery was in very poor shape and the phone would suddenly turn off when ...

Took the phone into Best Buy and was told by Best Buy the battery had 950 charging cycles on it and typically the batteries are only good for 500.  From my perspective "refurbished" is not an accurate description for the phone I received.

If you're willing to take a chance on a cheap phone, I'd suggest looking at another seller.

Title: Refurbished product in Certified Refurbished packaging no 3D Touch
Body: Obviously refurbished product in Certified Refurbished packaging. Some minor scratches on the metal housing of the phone and it appears the screen was replaced as there is some debris trapped between the housing and the screen. No big deal, I just pushed it into the crevice. Also, home button is very 'clicky' and the 3D Touch functionality does not work. Overall, none of this is a deal breaker. I'm not expecting an Apple refurbished phone at this price...A note on Certified Refurbished packaging. Seems like phones listed in Used Condition, Not Certified Condition, are still shown as "(Certified Refurbished)" in their description, so it's a bit confusing. If you want Certified Refurbished, look at the number of offers and filter by Certified Refurbished - this should ensure you get a refurbished phone. I also chose a seller with a high number of ratings figuring they would indeed be Certified Refurbished as in the description.

Title: Good purchase

I'm cautious about the limited storage space, but it's more than I had with my last phone.  Happy with my purchase so far.

Title: Happy with the purchase
Body: Used iPhone from Magic Mobile Partners.  Shipping was quick.  iPhone 6 works fine.  I've noted no blemishes or anything else that would distinguish it from being a new phone.  Battery life is good.  I was reluctant to buy a used iPhone from a source that was unknown to me, so paying more on Amazon with a vendor (Magic Mobile Partners) that was reliable seemed prudent...The process of deactivating my old iPhone 5S and restoring to the "new" iPhone 6 was made a bit lengthier since I had to update to "new" iPhone 6 to the current IOS version before using iTunes to bring my existing apps and data to the "new" iPhone. I spent about an hour and 1/2 with that process...I appreciate now having a decent amount of memory (my 5S only had 16GB) in the iPhone.  I would buy a used phone from Amazon and Magic Mobile Partners again.

Title: Great phone.
Body: I bought this because I was using an iPhone 5s and I thought it was long past time I upgraded.I use straight tslk wireless due to the price of service compared to that of a major wireless carrier.I was able to take the ZzZSIMNcstd out of my iPhone 5s.And put it in the iPhone 6, call up straight tslk and have them associate my SIM card with my new pbone's IMEI and iemdebtifyihg numbers and the new phone worked almost instantly.And while I think16.GBs isn't enough these days, I had the option of going higher I just couldn't afford it st the time,  so I don't put that on the produblct as I could've gotten the128 or 256 GB model and had plenty of room for all the apps I use all of my music and have some doscr left over for s few movies or tv shows!.No problem with the phone as of yet, thx to isn't an issue caused by the wireless carrier

Title: Faulty Item from Amazon Warehouse
Body: Purchased from the Amazon Warehouse.  This is not a review of the iPhone 6 in general, just the specific phone that I ordered.  Warehouse certified that the phone was in working order, but it exhibited significant battery problems from the start.  The battery level would be listed as 100%, then the phone would shut down.  When plugged back in to charge, the battery level would show as 100% again.  Also, the battery would drop from 100% into the single digits.  When plugged back in to charge, the level would be back to 100%.

Title: Very disappointed in this purchase
Body: Very disappointed in this purchase! I understood from reading other reviews that there was a chance that there could be a problem with the battery (that seemed to be the most common complaint); however, I was willing to take a chance given the price as well as the number of positive reviews...I regret the choice. The battery was completely used, once fully charged you could not use the phone for more than a few minutes before it shut down. To make things worse the screen was damaged, it was spongy (for lack of a better word) when you touched it and images would be slightly distorted (apparently this can happen when a battery goes bad, it can expand and damage the screen). Either of these issues (the battery and the screen) should have been easily identified in any sort of refurbishing process and there is no way this phone should have been sold as a certified refurbished product.

I wasn't expecting that because the other iPhone I got, came with a generic charger and no earbuds AND they were the same price! I wish I just bought two of these phones! I would highly recommend this vendor to purchase your iPhone!

Title: Check your battery right away
Body: So far so good. Had to re start the phone once when the screen froze and I am sure to not leave it on the charger past 80%, given the iphone 6 battery needs and because the phone only came at 88% of its original design capacity. Make sure the first thing you do is download the battery life app to determine if you received a less than adequate battery in your refurbished phone.

Title: Before reading the bad reviews and considering your option
Body: Before reading the bad reviews and considering your option, make sure you are aware of which seller the person bought the phone from. I bought a space grey 16 gb iphone from the seller VIP Outlet and so far the product has been great. I received it in a brown generic box including apple headphones and a charger cable. The phone looks brand new, and has no physical marks. It is functioning as good as a new Iphone, there was no problem switching my carrier over, the only thing I am concerned about is how long the battery life is suppose to run for, but since this is my first I phone I won't consider it a big deal. I recommend buying this product from VIP Outlet if you are considering getting this phone. :)

Title: Battery issues!
Body: Everything is A OK except for the battery. I had to update this phone to iOS 10.2 which I heard messed with the battery life in other phones so I don't know if this is an issue relating to that or the phone itself but it's an issue nonetheless..My phone will charge to 100% and everything is fine until I get to about 75%. My phone will drop to 14% or below in minutes and when I plug it in, the phone says it's charged 50% or so when it just told me it was 14%. It doesn't make sense!.I will update my review when Apple updates iOS to see if the issue is fixed.

Title: Terrible Job, damaged phone.
Body: When I purchased this I was expecting an iPhone 6S, because this listing appeared in the middle of all the other iPhone 6S listings. But I was disappointed to find out this was a 6. Then once I realized this wasn‚Äôt an S, and took it out of the box it had a golden halo around the Apple Logo on the back of the phone. Title: Customers can return them for cosmetic reasons like having a scratch
Body: I have bought refurbished phones before and they worked perfectly. Customers can return them for cosmetic reasons like having a scratch. This does not affect the functionality of the phone. However, this current phone that I just bought is unusable. The phone battery charging mechanism does not work. It all of a sudden shuts down even though the battery is almost fully charged. And it does not necessarily come back up after charging. I am going to take it to the apple store to see if anything can be done and will return it if not.

Title: Perfect except for..

I'm ordering a second one now after being refunded for the first one and I'm hoping that it will be T mobile compatible as advertised.  Overall the only reason this product didn't get the full five stars was that one of the two iPhones did not work when I put the SIM card in. Fast shipping & good quality otherwise.

Title: I have had this phone all of 5 mins and ...
Body: I have had this phone all of 5 mins and while setting it up it up the battery was too low to update so I plugged it in and the charger burnt me and probably would have burned my house down if I didn't check on it before I left! First thing I noticed when I was unraveling the charger was that it appeared off brand, then when I plugged it in nothing changed on the battery but figured since it was in set up mode that maybe the little changing symbol just wasn't going to appear. The changer from my old phone worked when I plugged it in and I need a phone now so I'm willing to wait a little longer before deciding to return it or not.

Title: the iPhone is too bad!!!DONT BUY IT!!

Title: it was quite good in the first 2-3 days

Later on, even the phone charged to 100%, the battery doesn't last for not even an hour. It comes down to 20% and later to 10% immediately within 20 mins or so! It is ridiculous. I tried charging the device with the original apple charger, even though its of no use. Its still the same. The BATTERY DOESN'T LAST FOR NOT EVEN AN HOUR. This device was actually suggested by one of the amazon customer service representatives. I NEVER TRUST those guys again. NEVER TAKE their suggestions. Please don't get this product. Its WASTE OF MONEY AND TIME.

Title: iPhone 6 with Touch Disease.
Body: Right from the start this "certified refurbished"  phone was often unresponsive and frequently froze up. The only way to revive it was to do a hard power-off and reboot it, and even that only worked some of the times. I returned the phone and three weeks later got a replacement, which was even worse: I could not even activate it, as it was frozen from the start. Some on-line research has revealed that this problem is common with the iPhone 6: it is a design problem that has been labeled "Touch Disease". Apparently the touch chips on the logic board often partially break off and you get intermittent electrical connections. I'll have to take it to an Apple store and see what they can do about it.

Title: Defective Battery. Certified Refurbished is a joke!
Body: Device has a bad battery. The first time, it took over 2 hours just to turn on. Kept it charging all night long and then the following day, it turned off at 45%. It wouldn't turn on, so I held the Power+Home button and it turned on showing I had 10% charge. It turned off right after and I repeated the process. Now, it shows 50% charge. There's clearly a calibration issue or the battery is defective. How is this a "certified-refurbished" unit?! I would like to replace this instead of getting a refund, but i'm afraid that I will get a similar unit that's defective as well. Listen to this review and many others & DO NOT BUY THIS.

Apple can't say I didn't give them a chance, however, back to the practical smart phone for me.

Title: Beware of charging Port Damage from normal use
Body: I bought five of these for my family all around two years ago. All of them have issues with the power adapter. One of them had just come off of AppleCare and the Genius told me that I had several bent or broken prongs in the adapter. They say that dirt gets into the slot from being in your pocket or purse and then when we plugin to charge they bend. The also told me that different prongs are used to charge from a computer versus a wall charger and also to communicate with a PC.  During the life of my devices I kept buying chords thinking it was the chord going bad but turns out it's the adapters...Also Apple seems to believe in planned obsolescence because they have no option to fix. They said if it was the battery they would fix for $80 but bent prongs cannot be fixed and their only remedy is to buy another iPhone 6 for $365. They also said other than cracked screens this is the most common problem...The iPhone 7 even puts the headphones through this jack making the design flaw even more of a problem because it's using more of these prongs...If you bought AppleCare definitely go in for a free power adapter test where they check each prong before apple care expires and you can get a new phone. They told me it's extremely common to find at least one issue with a 2 year old phone so this seems to be a way you can get your phone replaced. I wish I had known as my issue appeared literally weeks after AppleCare expired and they would not honor...What's ironic is my iPhone 2, 3, and 4 old phone charging port works fine. These no longer get IOS updates from apple but I long for the days when apple meant quality

Title: Bluetooth doesn't work
Body: If you actually use this phone to make phone calls and you do so via the Bluetooth in your car. Do not get this phone...I had an iPhone 6 and it worked flawlessly. I connected my new iPhone 7 and it started dropping the Bluetooth connect while making calls immediately...I've done everything apple told me to do. Didn't work. Did an online search of the problem and lots of people have the same issue...So now I'm stuck with a phone that doesn't work...So this will be my last apple product.

Title: Defective iPhone
Body: I purchased this phone for my mom and one day, the screen turned black and it was never responsive again. This was less than 3 months after activating the phone. I contacted the seller several times and they kept telling me the warranty is expired that I have to go to local repair store. Went to a mac repair store as well as the apple store. Both told me it is a hardware problem and not fixable. The only option is to buy a new phone. Again, seller not responsive to complaints, despite offering to send it back for them to evaluate. Don't make the same mistake and spend $350 on a defective product that only lasts less than 3 months.

Title: I have had this phone for the past 2 years and it has stayed in great condition. While I have dropped my phone several ...
Body: I purchased an iPhone 6 from a Verizon store. I have had this phone for the past 2 years and it has stayed in great condition. While I have dropped my phone several times over the past 2 years, it has never once cracked or had any issues. This product has been very sturdy, and I have not had any need to upgrade to a newer model. I can download and use just as many apps as owners with newer models can. This phone was worth the price that I paid for it. Many people with the same phone have complained about the battery life fading as the phone gets older but I have yet to experience it. This is not just for the phone I have, there was recently a case of Apple shortening the life of a battery to require customers to buy newer products. However, my phone works just as well as it did when I first got it..  I use my phone for so many different things, both for leisure and for academic uses. I use it to submit assignments when I am away from my laptop. I can stream movies off it and the lag depends on the WIFI I am connected to. I play games on it when I have time to kill. I am also an avid reader, so I can buy books and read them digitally on my phone. I would highly recommend this product to everyone. It has works very well, if it is taken care of, and would be a very useful tool. My phone is very important to me because there is important information inside. This product is well made and I feel more comfortable with it than the other models.

Title: The first time I bought a refurbished phone is also the last one!
Body: My phone has gone, just after 2 months of use. The first month was pretty good, the machine was hotter than usual but still good. From the second month, the bad thing happened to the battery and the power, the touch was not good and the screen was open. After buying a week, I left the US for a long vacation and could not do more than see my phone dying. Actually, In fact can not live even 60 days..I thought the battery was problematic. After returning to the US, I went to Apple Store yesterday and they checked it. The technician told me that it was not the battery problem, the battery was still working fine, but hardware have a big deal, the cost to fix it $299 + Tax (Equivalent to the amount I bought this phone!). Now it's just like a paperweight, no more..The first time I bought a refurbished phone is also the last one. Thank you!

Title: Refurbished phone with battery issues
Body: Despite claiming to be refurbished, my daughter had it for three days before the battery would be at 100%, then plummet to 20%, then switch itself off. It would turn itself back on, and stand at 12%, and drop again. This would happen until it was 'out of juice', despite having supposedly been fully charged just moments earlier. Appears to be a faulty battery, which is disappointing for a refurbished phone.

WRONG!.I‚Äôm on my second full charge of the day and it‚Äôs at 50% right now. I‚Äôm in a bind because I could send it back, but I won‚Äôt have a phone through the process. And, I can‚Äôt wipe the data to send it back without transferring data to another iPhone. This is what happens when you try to save a buck.

Title: Fabricated Battery Age
Body: This phone was sold to me as "certified refurbished", and yet when I took it to the Apple Store (for a myriad of problems) just under the 3-month mark of owning it, they told me that the battery could never have been lightly used when I bought the phone, as it has over 1,000 charge cycles on it, and I would only have been able to accrue 80-150 in three months. This phone was sold to me with a battery that was already past its lifespan! This was clearly NOT refurbished, and yet sold as such. I would like to return this, but it is past its return date. They should have a "discovery of fabrication" date for returns as well.

Title: Excellent

Title: Buyer Beware..... Additional cost for battery replacement that dealer not willing to meet !!!
Body: This is more of a dealer review than the phone. Product is fine with very minor scratches typical for a 4 year old phone. What is also typical is battery life. It drains very quickly in the cold. I went to Apple Store and had a diagnostic test which showed that battery has reached end of life to hold charge. The replacement cost is $29 by Apple Store in house. Dealer refused to meet this expense, instead opted for a prepaid, full refund to have the phone. I simply don't understand the policy of picking up the cost of return shipping, restocking the phone...... to sell to the next unsuspecting customer. I find this practice unethical..So buy it and you have to add $29 to the cost.
